titles.title: Don't Tax Our Fallen Public Safety Heroes Act
Don't Tax Our Fallen Public Safety Heroes Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude certain compensation received by public safety officers and their dependents from gross income.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: 9/18/2014--Passed Senate without amendment. Don't Tax Our Fallen Public Safety Heroes Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income, for income tax purposes, federal public safety officer death benefits or amounts paid under a state program to surviving dependents of a public safety officer who died as the direct and proximate result of a personal injury sustained in the line of duty.
